scenario:
Prologis (PLD) reported solid results for 2024, with core funds from operations (FFO) increasing 10.1% to $1.42 per share in the fourth quarter and 8.4% to $5.53 per share for the full year. The company's full-year results hit the high end of its revised guidance range. 

Occupancy remained strong at 95.9% at the end of the year, driven by a robust retention rate of 78.4%. New and renewal leases signed during the period were 40.1% higher than the prior ones on the same space on a cash basis, as the REIT capitalized on the significant increase in market rents over the past few years. This helped drive a 6.7% increase in cash net operating income (NOI) during the period.

The post-election resurgence in leasing activity has carried over into 2025, with ongoing conversations with customers supporting the expectation that the market is nearing an inflection point. Prologis expects core FFO to grow to a range of $5.70 to $5.86 per share in 2025, a 3.1% to 6% increase.

The company plans to start between $2.25 billion and $2.75 billion of development projects in 2025, a significant increase from the more than $1.3 billion of developments it started last year. This is due to its outlook that demand is nearing a tipping point and it anticipates customer needs and stays ahead of market trends.

Prologis' platform is uniquely positioned to seize the opportunities created by favorable trends in its data center and energy businesses, which will help add more power to its growth engine in 2025 and beyond. The company's optimistic outlook also bodes well for its dividend, which has grown at a 13% compound annual rate over the last five years, more than double the pace of the S&P 500 and REIT sector average.
